Reviews.Title: “Great Location but old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcia M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very old and worn looking. However, the rooms were very clean. The shower was so small, you could not move. The breakfast was awful, could not drink the coffee or the orange juice.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Saint Petersburg, Saint Petersburg City, Russia
Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Antonina T
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent -200 m to St. Peter's Square. Staff is very friendly. Room is comfortable. I would recommend this hotel for family economical trips.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Jma0504
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my wife and son (5 years old) and stayed 2 nights. The location is excellent -200 m to St. Peter's Square-, and the staff is friendly. Our triple room was pretty big and had a nice view to St. Peter's Dome over the roofs of the neighbour buildings. The hotel certainly needs some restoration, specially the bathrooms, but it has charm and everything is very clean. Breakfast was fine, we even made some take-away sandwiches. I would recommend this hotel for family trips.

Reviews.Title: “A bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: JeanandJim16 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although excellently located the hotel, once past reception, was a bit shabby. Our room was facing the 'serene inner courtyard' which was a collection of heating pipes and metal fire escapes and no view whatsoever other than the back of other buildings! The room decor was in a very poor state with cupboards doors that did not shut, peeling wallpaper, a TV without decent reception and a shower tray that overflowed if you were in for longer than a couple of minutes. We did not feel it worth asking for another room as we were on a city break and really only in the room to sleep so the fact that the bed was very good and we got a good sleep was all that mattered. We would not recommend this hotel for the price they command.

Reviews.Title: “First stay was nice but the second time, not as much”
Reviews.Author: aforeignaffair
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in Dec 2010 and we were pleasantly surprised. The room given to us was comfortable and very european (read: old world) in ambience. It had a tv and ref. Beds were comfortable. The bathroom was ok. What really impressed us was it was located literally at the back of The Vatican, so it was just a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We had to pay for wifi access but the price was reasonable and service was fast. This is why we opted to stay here again when we went to Rome in Oct. 2011, despite the higher room rate that was quoted (a difference of about 30 euros per night). However, we were quite disappointed when we did not get the same things that we had previously. The rooms that were given to us were very old, needed a paint job, very noisy at night (we're not sure if it was the plumbing or just outside noise) that we hardly had any sleep, and they were a lot smaller than the last time. Breakfast was unspectacular and the breakfast room was so small so everyone got in each other's way. Also, one guy at the reception could hardly speak english so it was really difficult to communicate what we wanted. This to me is important because what's the point in working at the reception of a hotel when you cannot communicate in a language other than your own? Therefore, on the basis of our last trip, I shall only rate this hotel as average.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Nikolay L
Reviews.Content: Great location - 200 m to St.Peter's square. Very nice and friendly staff. Area full of small stores and restaurants. Very well organized transport to the others sightseeings of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Emmaus”
Reviews.Author: Lee R
Reviews.Content: Best location, excellent service from all the staff especially Luigi who gave great advice and very helpful. Clean rooms, quaint "olde worlde" lift small shower the only drawback. Travelling for three weeks with our adult children staying in 3 & 4 star establishments Hotel Emmaus remains our most memorable.

Reviews.Title: “M & C D”
Reviews.Author: Michael D
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location for exploring Rome. Only 5 mins walk into St Peter's Square. Front of House staff were very helpful and the old lift was both beautiful to look at and worked well. The room was comfortable and clean and even had a refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Great reasonable accomodation in Rome”
Reviews.Author: pip045
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean, friendly and convenient to many attractions, The staff were friendly and helpful and the location was ideal for checking out St Peter's.

Reviews.Title: “To dinner by the Pope!”
Reviews.Author: William L
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly and helpful, excellent position near the Vatican, a few steps from st. Peter Square, in a very quiet area, easy accessible by public transport (there is the 64 bus which takes you right in the centre, Venice Square, and till the main station - Termini - in half an hour!); room quiet and comfortable in an old-fashioned building; a very rich continental breakfast is included in the price. I would really recommend it for a pleasent stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Mharyou
Reviews.Content: So far i didn't experienced a terrible one. Only thing is that why we're not allowed to check-in as early as we arrive. Does it relates to World Hotel SPO's? Thanks,

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Sorce19
Reviews.Content: Over priced, dirty rooms, poor front of house service and to top it all off the lift didn't work! We paid 95 euros a night and it was terrible clearly not a 3 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Emmaus central Rome”
Reviews.Author: StKittsUk
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as wanted somewhere central - can see the columns of St Peter's Piazza from the front door and some of the rooms. It was also the only central hotel I could find which offered two quad rooms which we needed. The building is old and the lift probably dates from the 1920's but thought it was great. We were in room 306 which had a double bed and two twin beds - large room, clean and tidy, bedding clean, ensuite clean as were towels, furniture was realatively new but decor a bit dated. Though it seems that some of the lower floors had be recently refurbished. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the lady doing breakfast remembered what everyone drank. Breakfast is continental buffet with fresh bread - yummy - meats, cheese, etc. The coffee was great. Overall the hotel was great and met our needs. Some of the rooms may be noisy as face onto the street but what can you expect in the centre of a busy tourist city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent again”
Reviews.Author: roma81jp
Reviews.Content: For the second year in a row our school group stayed with Emmaus hotel. Once more the staff were excellent and were more than helpful, the breakfasts were plentiful and the rooms all met the needs of our party! We will be looking to stay there next year!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Ganfa
Reviews.Content: + Sorry Indie had such a bad experience, but this was not our view, The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful (this is the second time we have stayed) The Lady at breakfast always smiled and wished us good morning, as did the reception staff, perhaps the staff react to the manner of the guests. The Bar opposite the hotel was great for food and drinks. We also found the staff there wonderful especially Giuseppe a Law Student who was very friendly and made our evenings special. We also spoke to some Italian Police who again were very friendly. We all had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, service is poor”
Reviews.Author: Indykim
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the hotel Emmaus on my first trip to Rome. At check in, the front desk clerk, a young woman was not totally unpleasant, but not helpful either. She did speak English, but had no interest in answering a couple of tourist type questions. We encountered the same reception with the three desk clerks we dealt with over the course of our stay, borderline rude, not at all helpful. The room was typical for a mid-priced European hotel, one twin bed, and two twins pushed together to make a double bed. There was a TV, small desk and armoire, no actual closet, we stacked our suitcases on top of each other. The bathroom was small and the shower, well, lets just say if you are even a few pounds overweight, you will not be able to get into the shower. Truly, the opening was so small my not-at-all overweight husband barely got in when he turned sideways. If you dropped the soap and tried to retrieve it, you could not bend forward as your head would be pressed against the shower wall. Breakfast was included in the price (I paid 150 euro per night) and this was good, pastry, meat, cheese, hard rolls, orange juice and the best coffee I have ever had. Once again, the woman who served breakfast, and made the coffee (no self serve coffee - she brings it on a tray, with steamed milk) was unpleasant and made you feel not welcome. Everyone ate in silence or whispering, the atmosphere was not friendly and everyone was there to enjoy Rome and their hotel stay. There is a restaurant a door or two down from the hotel, Caffe Vittoria, which was good, with nice, helpful waiters and good prices. We ate there three times as our waiter remembered us each time and was the only nice person we encountered during our stay in Rome. Okay - the good - the location is amazing. You walk out the door, cross the street and walk under a pedestrian tunnel. When you walk out of the tunnel, you are entering St.. Peter's square and the Basilica is looming over you - an awe-inspiring sight. We could see the dome of St. Peter's from our hotel window. The wait to get into the Basilica (and into the Sistine Chapel) was at least three hours every single day. It is worth it to be stopped by one of the young people selling tours (three are represented) and pay the 45 euro to skip the line and take the 2-4 hour tour. Once you are in and the tour is over, you can stay until it closes at 4:30. Everyone gets 15 minutes in the Sistine Chapel, but no time limit on anything else. I also recommend the 48 hour pass on one of the three open air bus tours - we did the 110 bus for 20 euro each. It takes about an hour to make the circuit and it is hop on/hop off at any of the stops, which are the main sights of Rome. The buses arrive at the various stops every 15-20 minutes. The main queue is right outside of St. Peter's Square. We also took the subway for one euro each and this was fine, but the route is limited. On the city bus back to the train station, the bus was jammed and my husband pulled a pickpocket's hand out of his pocket - the guy got nothing and jumped off at the next stop, but no one on the bus was even remotely interested in the thief being stopped until he could be handed over to one of the numerous police officers standing on various corners. Rome is beautiful, we had great weather, but I have never been anywhere else where the people are this rude and not helpful, from taxi and bus drivers, police officers and the staff of any store or hotel it was not a pleasant experience dealing with the people of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - service ??”
Reviews.Author: CrazyCruzer
Reviews.Content: the location is excellent, the breakfast is wonderful but the rooms are old and tired. The hairdryer in the room had a hole in hose so I tried to use my hair dryer and it blew the fuse, the entire room went dark! The floor tiles were lose and the elevator is so small there is no way you will fit with your luggage. the best bet is put the luggage in and race upstairs to meet them. The shower is also teeny tiny, all you have to do is soap up the sides and spin! I would highly recommend the Leonardo Di Vinci hotel, the rooms are awesome as the breakfast for the same price! The location is still excellent but not as close to the vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Miffy46
Reviews.Content: Hotel Emmaus is almost a relic itself! Very old & tired but friendly and helpful staff and a location to die for. Walking distance to the heart of Rome and about 250 meters from St Peter's Square. Rooms are very old fashioned and basic at best, breakfast was surprisingly adequate and the kitchen staff would always provide a cup of coffee before an early morning tour, even before the kitchen was officially open for breakfast. Train station was close by and lots of shops and restaurants in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Perfect for when travelling with a group”
Reviews.Author: kimberly2702
Reviews.Content: I was with a group that stayed there at the end of june. The location is perfect for the vatican and it's easy to get the metro to places like the colloseum. Hotel is clean and comfortable. Staff are very helpful. Would stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: roma81jp
Reviews.Content: Our group stayed at Emmaus at the end of June. The hotel is quiet, clean and comfortable, with an excellent location so close to the Vatican. The staff are excellent and will do anything to help Would highly reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: shunterjon
Reviews.Content: Depends on what your looking for in a hotel. We were all(there was 7 of us in 3 rooms, 2 facing the front street the other at the back) happy with our choice of the hotel. Dated it may be, the Hilton it's not. Our 3 rooms were fine, comfortable and quiet too. With free breakfast of a pot of tea/coffee it was ok, mind not a lot though. The hotel staff were very helpful. There's also internet by the checkin desk at a resonable €2 per hour. We found a great cafe across the road called Max Bar. Very reasonable prices and great food. Travel nearer the Vatican and the prices shoot up. The Vatican can be seen from the hotel entrance and is just 5 minutes walk via a pedestrian tunnel under the busy main road.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location to Vatican"”
Reviews.Author: KAnnie32
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Emmaus is situated perfectly to the Vatican. It takes minutes to walk to the middle of St. Peter's Square right in front of the Basillica. The rooms are average and the hotel is old but they have made it clean and the price reflects the authenticity. There is a fantastic coffee/gelato shop right next door and the street life is fantastic and busy. You will feel like you are in Roma. Words of warning! Restaurants in the area are very very close but a word of warning on the ones that cater to the tourists, they add on everything to your bill and run it up. Bread, a la carte courses, encouraging you to get side dishes...this is the way they operate. Tonight's incident at the restaurant Postiglione across the street claimed that the phone lines were down and we had to pay cash vs credit card. The waiter said for us to use the nearby ATM machine for the cash...Huh?? The phone lines were down in the city of Rome??? He wanted us to pay cash instead of CC so they could get reduced fees. They pull this on all the tourists. The restaurants will be tourist abusers, so you are better off going in the pizzerias several blocks away from the Vatican wall and into the neighborhoods that cater to the locals and aren't out to rip the tourists. Anything within the view of the wall ( a few exceptions) will take advantage of you. Just a word of warning to keep an eye out for these places and don't be all trusting.

Reviews.Title: “very close to the vatican”
Reviews.Author: AlexRosell
Reviews.Content: Emmaus is a basic hotel that has a very friendly staff and is a 5 minute walk to St. Peters. Breakfast was very basic but free. The hotel stands out because of the caring staff. The rooms are a bit dated but clean. The TV does not have cable or any english language stations. I paid a very reasonable price and I would stay again if I were visting the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “loved it everytime”
Reviews.Author: fanofemmaus
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Emmaus a half a dozen times from 2000 until this year. It is a wonderful place to stay in Rome as it is right off St. Peter's Square. I have brought sisters, students, friends and family here with great success. It is truly an Italian hotel. It is not a Marriott, if you are looking for that, stay in the USA. To really experience Rome, go to the Emmaus. MaryTherese Connors, DHCE Duquesne University Pittsburgh, PA USA

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: zeckster
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for location and it was a nice stay. We enjoyed the proximity to the Vatican. The cleanliness and breakfast was average on the scale. The location and hospitality were well above average. Our party stayed in two rooms. The room on the interior was rather triangle shaped but adequate, the exterior room was on a busy street that became active very early. We advise requesting the interior rooms for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: San Benedetto del Tronto (live in Canada)
Reviews.Title: “Location great...hotel...not so much!”
Reviews.Author: Barbie001
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is great. Just a few steps to St. Peter's Square. Parking is a challenge but we finally found a parking garage. As for our room, we were dumped out the back door. We then had to walk past the laundry room and up a very narrow steep flight of stairs to where there was a single door. Our view was of another window across the alley. The room was tiny but seemed clean enough. The bathroom however had mold all around the shower. The toilet worked on and off. There was no hot water whatsoever. The A/C was turned off and it took some talking to try to get the breaker turned back on. The breakfast buffet was ok. There was a good restaurant next door where the service staff was excellent and the food was good. Luckily, we just slept in the room as we were walking around the rest of the time. If you want to spend any time in the room, I wouldn't suggest this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Kamloops_Couple
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just got back from our trip to Europe. We stayed in Rome for 4 nights at this hotel. Unless you are on a tight budget, we would not recommend it. Our room was small and very dated. This property has not been updated in many, many years. The photos on the hotels website are a bit misleading. The wallpaper was peeling off and although the room was basically clean, it was a bit grubby. The bed (which took up virtually all of the floor space) was as hard as rock. Breakfast was included in the room price (85 Euros) and was good. The location is pretty good, but a bit of a walk to the main vatican areas, on the opposite side from the Museum, etc. It is very close to St. Peters Square and the Basilica though. It would be worth paying a little more and being on the other side of the square, where everything is closer. To get to the vatican you have to go through an underpass with some interesting people, but seemed pretty safe. The bus passes by the hotel and goes directly to the Termini, which is handy. The same bus takes you to many other parts of the centre as well. The location limits your dining options near the hotel. The restaurant just up the street (turn right out the hotel door, first place on the right) is pretty good. The food was fresh, tasty and the service is good and unhurried. The price is pretty good too. About 80 to 100 Euros for a full dinner with wine and drinks (for two people). The place directly across the street is terrible (unless you like microwaved pasta and store-bought sauces). The other bars across the street are pretty good for a snack and a beer/wine.

Reviews.Title: “Vatican location best thing going for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: gymcoach10
Reviews.Content: The location is the best thing about this hotel, 5 min. to St. Peters Sq. I had a single, the walls are paper thin, I gave the newlyweds down the hall an 9.5 for the entertaining noise. the breakfast was adequate, the desk people were ok, If your on a budget and want to spend the money on Rome and not the room this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: kmr100
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a super location if you want to be near the Vatican. You can see the dome of St Peter's from the top floors windows. It is too far to walk in the evening to the centre but the 64 bus runs regularly from outside the hotel. There are not many places to eat near the hotel, though the two restaurants we tried were fine. The staff were friendly. The bed was very comfortable. However, the street which is near a main road is very noisy, the wallpaper on one of the bedroom walls was falling off. The smell in the bathroom from the sink and toilet was awful - a real smell of bad drainage. Breakfast was a buffet style and was ok - but limited choice. We had to prompt the staff to bring extra croissants. The hotel was expensive for what the standard of accommodation, but I guess it is because of its location. The room could have been cleaner. The bathroom lokoed very dated, so did the furniture. The gloosy brochure we picked up in reception does not resemble the hotel. Wish it did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Mark0313
Reviews.Content: within 5 minutes walk of vatican. directly on central bus line; about 10-15 min walk to Metro (underground). at least 3 cafe/restaurants within 3 minutes of hotel. safe, clean, excellent choice for anyone visiting Roma. We stayed for 4 nights, and saw all of the city with this hotel as our base. we purchased a 3 day ticket good for all bus/metro lines, and we could get anywhere within just minutes...getting around was very easy. the room was large, very clean, but you will experience road noise since it is close to the main street going towards the vatican. it didn't bother us, but it might some. we don't spend a lot of time in the room, so as long as it is clean, has a decent bath or shower, and is in a great location, it works. this hotel had it all. i would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value near Vatican.”
Reviews.Author: GeordieJimmy
Reviews.Content: Good values rooms, and although simply laid out, are spacious enough and clean. The vicinity to the Vatican is a bonus if thats what you are in Rome for, but a nice walk down the river takes you into Trastevere and just across the river is the centre. We had a quadruple room that worked out quite cheap, and we didn't have any problems with the noise although some of the other guests did. There seemed to be a lot of priests and people working in the Vatican staying there which I suppose is a good sign, but would stay there again simply for value for money, and the spectacle of St Peters which is practically out of the front door of the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Hop, Skip Away from Benedict!”
Reviews.Author: Chris J
Reviews.Content: The property is on a side street near the Vatican Colonnade, with a grocery up the road, small trattorias (and chinese restos) souvenir shops (whatelse) and clergymen (and women !!!) Quaint elevator (but for three adults with 60-80 Kg worth of luggage, everything has to be choreographed). Rooms are a bit dated and dark (ours had a nice tree outside the window) but the lavatory is another story (we got used to the THX sound of the flush) inside the room. Other than that, it is best to enjoy Rome and return to the room tired and exhausted. breakfast was adequate (At least they had cereal.. in hotel florida, venice... only croissants!) staff were generally nice and helpful (especially the lady and the older gentleman, whose names escape me) Overall hotel is adequate for pilgrim and budgetty types.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tourachitect
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a reasonably priced, no frills hotel very near the Vatican, this is it. I'm in Rome frequently and have used this hotel twice. Rooms are simple and fairly clean, although one in our group was on the lowest floor, (rear) and had bugs in the bathroom (which I guess is common in Roma). AC worked well, staff is very friendly, good restaurants nearby...but the Bernini's columns of St. Peter's Square are literally a good golfball hit away.

Reviews.Title: “Pokey and in need of decoration but with 'character'”
Reviews.Author: AllyDick2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January 2006. My girlfriend was working in Rome for a month and I just needed this place to sleep for three nights while I visited her. At first, the hotel looked very small from the outside and it was no different inside.The reception was very small. The lift to the rooms was very old-style indeed e.g. you stepped into a wooden 'box' and closed the two tiny wooden doors behind you - not for the faint hearted ! The bedrooms were reasonably large though and the bed was MASSIVE. It was comfortable as well.The shower area was quite small though although it was clean I didn't have breakfast over the course of my stay as I preferred to lie in. The main positives were the proximity to the Vatican and the Metro and also the price was fairly reasonable. Also, although the hotel was small and old fashioned, it had a nice atmosphere. You really felt you were in the old side of Rome. It was my first trip to Rome so I enjoyed the feeling of being in an atmospheric location The negatives were that the doors to the bedroom were very 'flimsy' e.g. it would have been very easy for someone to break into the room, the staff at the reception desk were fairly nice and attentive but it was impossible to get through to them when I asked them could they order a taxi for my girlfriend at night (she had to board with others as she was on a course in the Vatican). Her accomodation was a mile from the hotel and I wasn't happy to let her walk back to it as there were lots of badly-lit roads that I was afraid to let her walk down on her own. On the first night, I successfully got the receptionist to order a taxi but there was no such luck on the next two nights and I had to walk her home - a round trip of two miles after midnight - not nice. Overall, I don't think I would come back here but I enjoyed the experience all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Value with location”
Reviews.Author: rro
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in other hotels in Rome, but this was by far the best value. The rooms may be dated, but I didnt really spend too much time. Some rooms on the upper floors even have a view of St Peter's Square and Basilica. This hotel is all about the location. The breakfasts are typical Italian, so don't expect much. Also, the owners are genuine people. They will change larger bills that the ATMs give out to smaller usuable money. Do not expect much from this hotel other than a bargain with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy at night, Good Budget Hotel, Close to Vatican City.”
Reviews.Author: chris1107
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Rome for 10 days at the Hotel Emmaus in November'05. I had a single room which was more spacious than I was expecting. I was a little apprehensive about this hotel based on the reviews that I read on this website. The major complaints seemed to be about noise from within the hotel and bathrooms that flooded. I will say that I did not have any problems regarding my bathroom, although I did happen to overhear another patron discussing this issue at the front desk. Apparently his shower drain was not operating too well and flooded the bathroom with water. As far as noise is concerned, that's a problem for me. I had alot of trouble getting to sleep due to people slamming the elevator doors. Once I had an issue with a another guest banging on a tambourine and singing badly at 11pm, but that's certainly not the hotel's fault - just a rude patron with bad rhythm and a horrible voice to say the least. I should also mention the good things. It is in a very good location. In 2 minutes you can walk to the Vatican City. This worked well for me. After attending a papal audience I was able to get back to the hotel very quickly. Some good restraunts/cafes are located just outside the hotel. I was fond of walking across St.Peters square at night and grabbing an evening meal in the Borgo area on the north side of Vatican. My favorite night spot was a club called "Alexanderplatz", a jazz club located just north of the Vatican. The hotel does have a nice breakfast available and the staff was very helpful. My room was always very clean. The 64 bus stops right in front of the hotel. This is great because this bus just happens to travel between St.Peters and Termini Station via Corso Vittorio Emanuele. In conclusion, if you think you can stand a little ambient noise from the traffic of people returning to their rooms at night, I can recommend this hotel since you will not find a much better price/location combination. If you desire absolute quite at night find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster Disaster ”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandJohn
Reviews.Content: This is one of the finest examples of how mis-leading pictures on a web site can be. On arrival at the hotel reception and having been met by young man who just wanted to finish his shift we were ushered to our room. After a few minutes on our own I could see my wifes eyes filling up with tears and embarked on a late night exercise to find another hotel. Sure the location was good, but a back alley room with one window that looked on to a brick wall, copious amounts of black mould in the shower, no toilet paper to wipe away the tears! and a damp musty smell all over made me want to puke. (We found another hotel folks you'll be glad to know after paying the get out fee!) Dont do this to yourselves. This hotel needs a miracle or ten! Still having nightmares about it. The inspectors would have a field day with this one

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: fredd
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in Italy with our 2 children and travelled throughout many cities over a 2 week period. We ended our stay in Rome, great city, way too big for 5 days, need a t least 2 weeks here alone. We stayed right off of St. Peter's square and the Vatican at the Hotel Emmaus, it was great!!! The staff was truly lovely people who treated us with such kindness and warmth. This was a great location for us to go throughout the city on various excursions on our own and really get a taste of Rome. We can't thank the staff enough for making our stay fabulous, Vincent was very nice and quite helpful. Again, thanks for making our stay truly fabulous and memorable and ending our trip in such a positive light. We will definitely be back and stay at Hotel Emmaus again....

Reviews.Title: “Good Location-Bathroom Noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My recent stay (Feb/2005) at Hotel Emmaus for 5 nights was good, with a few negatives. First time in Roma and the location of Hotel Emmaus provided me with many opportunities to walk and see most of Roma's historical sites (a two minute walk to the Vatican). The room was big and spacious for 3 people. However, we found the toilet in need of a bit of renovations. At each flush, the water pipes seemed like they were going to explode and made a disturbing loud noise throughout the hotel. Also, with every usage of the sink tap, water would flow from the bottom onto the floor. And the shower stale, we found, was built for someone who weighted no more than 100 pounds. The breakfast was average; improvements could be made on the coffee making....a little stronger. The staff was courteous and approachable and well versed in English & Italian. I would recommend if you don't mind the aging pipe noise.

Reviews.Title: “shabby...shabby!”
Reviews.Author: memorybee
Reviews.Content: We ended up at this hotel at 3am after arriving at our B&B and finding they had no rooms and had us down for the wrong dates. I would never choose to stay at the Hotel Emmaus. The first room we were in was so small and wierd shaped that we couldn't hardly close the door and open our suitcases. We moved to another room that was so filthy and had black mold all over the walls in the bathroom. We moved again and this room was fine but just felt creepy. The breakfast is very good with fresh pastries and ham and cheese and rolls and cereal, etc. The taxi stand out front is very convenient.

HotelInfo.Name: Emmaus
HotelInfo.Address: Via Delle Fornaci 23-25, 00165 Rome, Italy
